fields.name: Dengue Fever
premedication: No specific antiviral medication for dengue; focus on symptom relief.
treatment_plan: Paracetamol (to manage fever and pain; avoid NSAIDs like aspirin or ibuprofen as they increase bleeding risk).
Stay hydrated (IV fluids if needed for severe cases).
Monitor for warning signs of dengue hemorrhagic fever.
diet_plan: Papaya leaves juice (may improve platelet count).
Hydration with water, ORS, and coconut water.
Foods rich in vitamins and antioxidants (kiwi, oranges).
not_to_eat: Oily, fried, and spicy foods (hard on the stomach).

fields.name: Malaria
premedication: Artemisinin-based combination therapies (ACTs) for resistant strains.
treatment_plan: Regular blood tests to monitor parasitic load.
diet_plan: High-calorie foods (bananas, rice, potatoes) for energy.
Iron-rich foods (spinach, red meat) to combat anemia caused by malaria.
not_to_eat: Alcohol (can strain the liver, already affected by malaria).

fields.name: Diarrhea
premedication: ORS (Oral Rehydration Salts) to prevent dehydration.
Loperamide (only if diarrhea is non-infectious and persistent).
treatment_plan: Stay hydrated with water, ORS, or clear broths.
Identify and treat the cause (e.g., bacterial infections may require antibiotics).
not_to_eat: Dairy products (except yogurt; may worsen symptoms).

fields.name: Common Cold and Flu
diet_plan: Warm soups (chicken soup helps reduce inflammation).
Ginger and honey (for sore throat relief).
not_to_eat: Dairy if it increases mucus production in some individuals.

fields.name: Typhoid Fever
not_to_eat: Raw vegetables or unpeeled fruits (risk of contamination).
Spicy and greasy foods (hard on the digestive system).

fields.name: Cholera
premedication: ORS to replace lost fluids and electrolytes.
Antibiotics like Azithromycin in severe cases.
diet_plan: Soft, easily digestible foods (rice porridge, boiled potatoes).

fields.name: Tuberculosis (TB)
premedication: First-line TB drugs: Rifampin, Isoniazid, Pyrazinamide, Ethambutol.
treatment_plan: Strict adherence to a 6-month or longer treatment plan.
Monitor liver function (some drugs are hepatotoxic).
diet_plan: Foods rich in Vitamin C and E (oranges, almonds).
not_to_eat: Alcohol (interferes with medication and strains the liver).

fields.name: Jaundice
premedication: No specific medication; treat underlying cause (e.g., antiviral for hepatitis).
diet_plan: Fluids like sugarcane juice and coconut water.

fields.name: Chickenpox
not_to_eat: Spicy, acidic, or salty foods (can irritate mouth sores).

fields.name: Pneumonia
premedication: Antiviral drugs if caused by viruses.
treatment_plan: Use of humidifiers to ease breathing.
